intro: Mallotus nepalensis var. kwangtungensis, commonly known as the Kwangtung Mallot, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to Southeast Asia. It typically grows to a height of 3–8 meters and has compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by woody capsules containing numerous seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
